qas.question: In what year did the three original  cantons join with five other cantons to form the "Old Confederacy" of eight states?
Which century did the Old Confederacy of the eight states exist until?
What effect did the expansion of the three cantons into eight have on the status of the federation?
By 1460, who controlled most of the territory south and west of the Rhine?
Which Swiss victory in 1499 amounted to de facto independence within the Holy Roman Empire?

context: <a0_0>By 1353<a0_0/>, the three original cantons had joined with the cantons of Glarus and Zug and the Lucerne, Zürich and Bern city states to form the "Old Confederacy" of eight states that existed until the <a1_0>end of the 15th century<a1_0/>. The expansion led to <a2_0>increased power and wealth<a2_0/> for the federation. By 1460, <a3_0>the confederates<a3_0/> controlled most of the territory south and west of the Rhine to the Alps and the Jura mountains, particularly after victories against the Habsburgs (Battle of Sempach, Battle of Näfels), over Charles the Bold of Burgundy during the 1470s, and the success of the Swiss mercenaries. The Swiss victory in the <a4_0>Swabian War<a4_0/> against the Swabian League of Emperor Maximilian I in 1499 amounted to de facto independence within the Holy Roman Empire.
